Label: α-GalCer
Comment: α-galactosylceramide

Label: IRF4
Comment: Induction of high concentration of IRF4 after B cell activation drives the rapid generation of plasmablasts. On the contrary, low concentrations of IRF4 may enable sustained expression of AID, CSR, and GC B cell response.

Label: IRF8
Comment: IRF8 dampens signaling via BCR and facilitates antigen-specific interaction with T helper cells. It also promotes antibody affinity maturation while antagonizing IRF4 driven differentiation of plasmablasts.  High IRF8:IRF4 ratio promotes GC differentiation.

Label: CXCL12
Comment: CXCL12 is expressed in the medullary cords of the lymph nodes and in the bone marrow.

Label: PD1
Comment: PDCD1/PD1

Label: ISG15
Comment: ISG15 acts as a chemoattractant for neutrophils. PBs that secrete ISG15 are a proinflammatory feature in autoimmune diseases like SLE.

Label: CRP
Comment: C-reactive protein (CRP), an acute phase reactant in the IL-6 pathway commonly used as a biomarker of COVID-19 severity.

Label: CD69
Comment: Upon encounter with their cognate antigen, B cells rapidly upregulate CD69.  CD69 is an inhibitor the lymphoid egress , mediating receptor S1P1 and resulting in secondary lymphoid organ retention.

Label: XBP1
Comment: X-box binding protein-1 (XBP-1) is esssential for plasma cell differentiation.

Label: Blimp1
Comment: PRDM1/Blimp1

Label: ZEB2
Comment: ZEB2 is a transcription factor that is highly expressed in DN2 cells and aNAV cells. ZEB2 cooperatively acts with T-bet to promote effector differentiation and inhibit memory differentiation in cytotoxic T cells.

Label: TBET
Comment: TBX21/TBET is expressed in high amounts by DN2 B cells but also aNAV.

Label: APRIL
Comment: TNFSF13/APRILstimulates AID induction independently of CD40.

Label: PTPRC
Comment: CD45

Label: CD11c
Comment: DCs in the medullary cords or the T zone of the lymph nodes express high amounts of CD11c.  CD11c forms a heterodimer with CD18

Label: PAX5
Comment: PAX5 is a dual function activator and suppressor and is required for germinal center formation. PAX5 along with Bach2 and Bcl6 stabilize The GC B cell state while antagonizing plasma cell differntiation.

Label: FOXO1
Comment: Transcription factor FOXO1 inhibits T-bet-mediated effector functions and promotes memory CD8(+) T cell differentiation.

Label: CR1
Comment: CR1 (CD35)

Label: TMSB10
Comment: gene TMSB10 is Pax5-repressed

Label: HSPA8
Comment: associated with metabolic processes and autophagy

Label: BACH2
Comment: Stabilizes GC B cells while aantagonizing plasma cell differeentiation.

Label: MS4A1
Comment: MS4A1/CD20

Label: BAFF
Comment: B cell activating factor (BAFF)

Label: ETS1
Comment: DN2 B cells and aNAV B cells express the lowest amounts of ETS1.  ETS1 inhibits PC differentiation. Deficiency of ETS1 may cause extrafollicular accumulation of autoreactive plasma cells.

Label: PTCRA
Comment: Pre T-cell antigen receptor alpha, pT-alpha, pTa (pT-alpha-TCR)

Label: IL-6
Comment: IL-6 mainly promotes differentiation of antigen-specific B cells to plasmablasts.

Label: BCL6
Comment: transcription factor; critical regulator of Tfh differentiation. Lack of Bcl6 in CD4+T cells leads to inability to differentiate into Tfh cells.

Label: PD1
Comment: inhibitory receptor

Label: c-Maf
Comment: musculoaponeurotic fibrosarcoma (c-Maf)

Label: IL12
Comment: IL-12 regulates humoral immunity by strongly inhibiting TFH differentiation. In vitro, it induces IFNγ and IL-21 in human T cells. (IL12A)

Label: CXCR5
Comment: the chemokine receptor CXCR5 is increasingly expressed upon follicle entry via the CXCL13 gradient.

Label: Blimp1
Comment: PRDM1/Blimp-1 (B lymphocyte-induced maturation protein-1): Upregulation of Blimp-1 expression is associated with plasmablast differentiation.

Label: IL12
Comment: IL-12 regulates humoral immunity by strongly inhibiting TFH differentiation. In vitro, it induces IFNγ and IL-21 in human T cells. (IL12A)

Label: IL-6
Comment: IL-6 mainly promotes differentiation of antigen-specific B cells to plasmablasts.

Label: BCL6
Comment: Follicular pathway leads to Bcl6-expressing germinal center B cells known as centroblasts and centrocytes. Bcl6 is a transcriptional repressor that inhibits the diffenertiation towarrds plasmablasts by repressing Blimp1

Label: CD35
Comment: CD35 or CR1

Label: CD21
Comment: CR2 or CD21

Label: MFGE8
Comment: Mfge8 or FDC-M1

Label: CCR7
Comment: Increased expression of the CCR7 receptor indicates the interaction of B cells with the antigens. In B cells that lack CCR7, antigen engagement fails to cause movement to the T zone. CCR7 interacts with the chemokines CCL19 and CCL21.

Label: EBI2
Comment: EBI2 or GPR183 is highly expressed in B cells and is increased following their activation. EBI2 is required for the proper localization to inter- and outer-follicular niches of B cells following T-dependent antibody response. EBI2 is downregulated when B cells differentiate into GC cells. Lack of EBI2 correlates with reduced T-dependent antibody response.  Differentiation between germinal center and extrafollicular-destined B cells occurs during this process of acivation through the expression of EBI2. Loss of EBI2 --> GC
